chargingpoint module¶

Created on Mon Jan 28 14:22:59 2019

@author: draz

class chargingpoint.ChargingPoint(data, power_nominal)¶

Bases: object

Represents the charging points.

Parameters

power_nominal (float) – Power the station charges the vehicle with.

Variables

  • self.location – Location of the charging point/station. Needs to be adjusted when data can be provided.

  • self.station_id – Identifier for each charging point.

  • self.type_lp – DC or AC charging.

  • self.power_nominal – Nominal power of the charging point.

  • self.power_factor – Power factor (cos(phi)) of the grid.

  • self.power_min – Minimal power the charging point can charge with.

  • self.power_max – Maximal power the charging point can charge with.

  • self.xcharging_power – The charging or discharging power for a specific time step.

  • self.availability – Availability of the charging point (0 ev is connected, 1 no ev is connected).

  • self.connected_ev – ID of the connected ev.

  • self.time_start_xcharging – Time the charging/discharging starts.

  • self.load_profile – Time series data of the charging power.

  • self.control – Control type as per assumptions.

  • self.served_evs – Counter for every connected ev that charged/discharged.

  • self.occupancy – Time series data, 0 for charging point is available and 1 for charging point is used.

  • plan (self.charging) – Day ahead plan for the charging schedule.

assign_ev(ev=None, t=None)¶

Dock vehicle to the station.

Parameters

  • ev – Instance of the vehicle

  • t (int) – Current time step.

check_power()¶

Check if the charging power is within its limits and assign accordingly.

station_data(t=None)¶

Print out key values of the instance.

Parameters

t (int) – Current time step.

update_availability(t=None)¶

Disconnect the vehicle if the parking time is over.

Parameters

t (int) – Current time step.
